US women take soccer gold

The US women's soccer team won the Olympic gold medal in a 2-1 game, avenging one of its most painful defeats with its victory over Japan. (AP, 5:46 p.m.)

SJC: What judges think is protected

The state's highest court ruled judges cannot be forced to disclose to ethics investigators what they were thinking when they made their rulings. (Boston Globe, 4:45 p.m.)

News

Postal Service loses $5.2b in Q3

The ailing US Postal Service is reporting quarterly losses of $5.2 billion. Losses were $2.1 billion more than during the same period in 2011.
